isis.stitle: Procedural Guideline - ENGINE FRONT COVER - BOTH SECTIONS (I-6), REPLACE

wtsproc.wtsdescrip: ENGINE FRONT COVER - BOTH SECTIONS (I-6), REPLACE
wtsproc.config: Vehicle is equipped with air conditioning.

step1.para: Chock wheels. Open hood.
Disconnect battery.
Remove front bumper.
Remove hood; include disconnect wiring (2 people).
Drain cooling system.
Remove complete air filter assembly.
Remove both charge air pipes.
Evacuate air conditioning system.
Disconnect air conditioning lines at condenser. Cap ends.
Disconnect all coolant hoses to radiator.
Install lifting device to radiator assembly.
Disconnect radiator support struts at frame mount.
Loosen lower radiator support bolts. Tilt radiator assembly forward for access to engine fan. Using proper tools, remove fan/clutch assembly.
Remove lower radiator support bolts. Remove radiator assembly.
Remove serpentine belt.
Remove bolts retaining fan pulley. Remove pulley. Remove bolts retaining fan mount. Remove fan mount.
Disconnect line/hoses at air conditioning compressor. Cap ends. Remove bolts retaining air conditioning compressor mount bracket. Remove compressor with bracket attached.
Remove bolts retaining belt tensioner. Remove tensioner.
Disconnect wiring at alternator. Remove wiring support clamps.
Remove bolts retaining alternator support bracket. Remove bracket with alternator attached.
Remove bolts retaining water pump pulley. Remove pulley. Remove bolts retaining water pump. Remove pump.
Remove bolts retaining injection pump gear cover plate. Remove plate.
Bring engine to number 1 firing order timing.
Remove bolts retaining crankshaft damper. Use puller and remove damper.
Remove crankshaft key way.
Remove bolts retaining oil pump assembly. Remove oil pump assembly and gasket.
Remove and install front crankshaft seal and wear ring. Use special tool.
Drain engine oil.
Remove bolts retaining oil pan. Remove oil pan.
Remove bolts retaining oil pick up tube. Remove tube and gasket.
Remove both bolts retaining front engine mounts.
Use bottle jack and suitable block of wood to support the engine. Raise/lower engine as needed.
Remove bolts retaining front engine mount bracket to block. Remove mount.
Loosen bolts retaining air compressor rear support bracket at engine.
Remove bolts retaining air compressor to front cover.
Remove bolts retaining front section of front cover. Remove front section of front cover.

note.para: These are the steps for the front cover front section only. Continue for rear section of front cover.

step1.para: Check to insure timing marks are in alignment.
Remove upper and lower idler gear retaining bolts. Remove gears.
Remove bolts retaining injection pump gear. Remove gear.

note.para: At this point, mark the position of camshaft gear to the rear section of the front cover. This is done for reference only. The camshaft gear will need to be rotated slightly in order for the jaws of the puller to fit into the opening of camshaft gear to remove it.

step1.para: Use special puller to remove camshaft gear.
Remove banjo fitting from outlet of fuel transfer pump for access.
Loosen bolts retaining injection pump support bracket at engine.
Remove nuts retaining injection pump to front cover.
Remove coolant filter.
Disconnect coolant hoses from rear section of front cover.
Remove bolts retaining rear section front cover. Remove cover and gasket.
Remove oil high pressure relief valve and seal from rear section of front cover.
Clean all necessary parts and mating surfaces.

note.para: Place camshaft gear in oven and heat to 350 degrees. Use temperature indicator stick. A liquid smear will show at the specified temperature rating.

step1.para: Install new gaskets on fuel injection pump, air compressor and rear section of front cover.
Install rear section of front cover. Torque all bolts.

note.para: Torque nuts retaining injection pump to rear section of front cover first, then torque bolts retaining injection pump support bracket at engine.

step1.para: Install banjo fitting to fuel transfer pump.
Install oil relief valve and seal.
Connect coolant hoses to rear section of front cover.
Install new coolant filter.
With camshaft gear heated to 350 degrees, install gear to camshaft.

warning.para: Use gloves intended for handling hot parts.

step1.para: After gear has cooled, move gear to original position mark on rear section of front cover.
Install upper and lower idler gears. Be sure gears are in proper time with outer gears. Torque bolts.

note.para: A new upper idler bolt must be used.

step1.para: Install injection pump gear. Torque bolts. Recheck timing marks on all gears.
Install front section of front cover with new gasket. Torque bolts except alternator mount bracket bolts and air compressor bolts.
Torque air compressor bolts first, then torque air compressor support bracket bolts at engine.
Install front engine mount bracket to block. Torque bolts.
Lower engine onto crossmember. Remove jack.
Install engine mount bolts. Torque bolts.
Install water pump and pulley. Torque bolts.
Install injection pump gear cover plate. Torque bolts.
Install oil pump pick up tube and gasket. Torque bolts.
Install oil pump assembly. Torque bolts.
Install crankshaft key way.

note.para: Use special heating tool to heat damper.

step1.para: Heat damper and install. Torque bolts.
Install alternator support bracket with alternator attached. Torque bolts.
Connect wiring to alternator and secure.
Install belt tensioner. Torque bolt.
Install air conditioning compressor mount with compressor attached. Torque bolts.
Install fan mount. Torque bolts. Install fan drive pulley. Torque bolts.
Install serpentine belts.
Install oil pan and gasket. Torque bolts.
Using lifting device, install radiator assembly in position. Do not tighten bolts at this time.
Install fan/clutch assembly.
Tighten radiator support struts and lower radiator support bolts.
Remove lifting device from radiator assembly.
Connect all coolant hoses to radiator and engine.
Connect all air conditioning lines.
Install both charge air pipes.
Install air filter assembly.
Fill cooling system.
Fill engine oil to proper level.
Charge air conditioning system.
Install hood; include connect wiring (2 people).
Connect battery.
Install front bumper.
Start engine and check for leaks.
Remove wheel chocks.
Road test vehicle.
